original_title: Zelda Guardian Sculpture Tracks Humans and Pets Via Camera
original_content:
In The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild Guardians are a primitive form of sentry turret that tracks the player with a watchful eye. Inspired by this, [npentrel] decided to whip up one of his own in the real world.
The build relies on a Raspberry Pi kitted out with its usual camera for machine vision purposes. It uses the Viam robot toolkit, which runs a machine learning model to detect pets and humans on the camera feed. The guardian then tracks any pets or humans that show up by turning its head, and thus the camera, with a servo controlled by a PWM signal via the Raspberry Pis GPIO pins. Its all wrapped up in a nicely-decorated 3D printed model that really does look like something straight out of Breath of the Wild.
Sentry projects are a great way to learn about electronics, mechanics, and image processing techniques. Its funny to see how advanced and complicated these projects were fifteen years ago, compared to how easy they are today with modern machine learning libraries. How times change!
title: Raspberry Piで作る看守ロボット 「ゼルダの伝説」にヒントを得て
body: ゲーム「ゼルダの伝説ブレスオブザワイルド」の護衛がモチーフ。Raspberry Piとカメラを使い、ペットや人を検出、検知するシステムを作成。電子工作と画像処理技術を学ぶ良い方法。近年の機械学習ライブラリの進化により、以前は高度で複雑であった電子工作が簡単になった。
